meanings.definition: The practice or system of white domination and exploitation in South Africa during the apartheid era.
meanings.sent1: Baaskaap was a cruel system that oppressed many people in South Africa.
meanings.sent2: During apartheid, baaskaap led to the unfair treatment of non-white individuals.
meanings.sent3: The concept of baaskaap seemed absurd to those who believed in equality for all.
meanings.sent4: The shadow of baaskaap loomed large over the country's history.
meanings.sent5: The impact of baaskaap on society was profound and long-lasting.

meanings.definition: The attitude or belief in the superiority of one race over others.
meanings.sent1: Baaskaap often leads to discrimination and prejudice against other races.
meanings.sent2: The belief in baaskaap can fuel harmful stereotypes and divisions among people.
meanings.sent3: Some individuals hold onto baaskaap without realizing the harm it causes.
meanings.sent4: The poison of baaskaap can infect even the most harmonious communities.
meanings.sent5: Overcoming the mindset of baaskaap requires empathy and understanding.
